poem:
AI in the Lecture Hall

As machines whisper  
in the quiet halls.  
Chalk-dusted voices   
seek truth—  
sifting silicon  
from syllabus.  

A lattice of thought  
woven, unwoven,  
yet we learn  
in the echo—  
humanity  
grappling with  
its own  
shadow.
